forkee.name: novu

issue.title: 🐛 Bug Report: CSS bug , Question Mark Icon overlapping
issue.body:
### 📜 Description

![image](https://github.com/novuhq/novu/assets/87201444/7c2a799d-1d79-4bdd-836f-123b831d05cd)
![image](https://github.com/novuhq/novu/assets/87201444/9b611d29-5afa-4688-a157-c25331b82bcc)


 The question mark icon overlaps with the text "Channels" in the screenshot. This is a bug because it makes the text difficult to read and can be confusing for users. 

### 👟 Reproduction steps

1. Goto Workflow -> Workflow Settings -> Channels 
2. Click on the Profile tab in the top right corner 

### 👍 Expected behavior

The profile tab should overlap the question mark icon 

### 👎 Actual Behavior with Screenshots

The question mark icon is overlapping the profile tab

### Novu version

Novu

### npm version

_No response_

### node version

_No response_

### 📃 Provide any additional context for the Bug.

_No response_

### 👀 Have you spent some time to check if this bug has been raised before?

- [X] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### 🏢 Have you read the Contributing Guidelines?

- [X] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/novuhq/novu/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Are you willing to submit PR?

Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -7,6 +7,75 @@ on:
   pull_request:
 
 jobs:
+  check_submodule_token:
+    name: Check if the secret exists or not.
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    outputs:
+      has_token: ${{ steps.secret-check.outputs.has_token }}
+    steps:
+      - name: Check if secret exists
+        id: secret-check
+        run: |
+          if [[ -n "${{ secrets.SUBMODULES_TOKEN }}" ]]; then
+            echo "::set-output name=has_token::true"
+          else
+            echo "::set-output name=has_token::false"
+          fi
+
+  trigger-e2e-ee:
+    name: RUN E2E-EE TESTS
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    timeout-minutes: 80
+    permissions:
+      contents: read
+      packages: write
+      deployments: write
+      id-token: write
+    needs: [check_submodule_token]
+    steps:
+      # checkout with submodules if token is provided
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        if: ${{ needs.check_submodule_token.outputs.has_token == 'true' }}
+        with:
+          submodules: true
+          token: ${{ secrets.SUBMODULES_TOKEN }}
+      # else checkout without submodules if the token is not provided
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        if: ${{ needs.check_submodule_token.outputs.has_token != 'true' }}
+      - uses: ./.github/actions/setup-project
+        with:
+          submodules: true
+      - uses: ./.github/actions/setup-redis-cluster
+      - uses: mansagroup/nrwl-nx-action@v3
+        with:
+          targets: lint
+          projects: "@novu/api"
+
+      - uses: ./.github/actions/start-localstack
+
+      - uses: ./.github/actions/run-worker
+        with:
+          launch_darkly_sdk_key: ${{ secrets.LAUNCH_DARKLY_SDK_KEY }}
+
+        # Runs a single command using the runners shell
+      - name: Build API
+        run: CI='' pnpm build:api
+
+      - name: Build Submodules
+        run: CI='' pnpm build:ee-auth
comment.body:
I see, we could.
Here i was afraid to build redundant libs so the runtime would increase, but we could build it all for now so it will be more simple and then optimize if needed.

feat: add script create release with submodules

pull_request.title: feat: add script create release with submodules
pull_request.body:
### What change does this PR introduce?

* Create version update in the monorepo and submodule.
* Updated the submodule repo with commit and tag. 
* Updated the main repo with commit and tag.

### Why was this change needed?

So we could create a version in one flow.

### Other information (Screenshots)

Addition point to check:
* We need to validate that there is no uncommit files in a submodule, if there is we need to throw an error (in the main repo lerna takes care of it)
